Perle Discloses Partial List of Retail Customers
Perle Device-Networking Hardware facilitates smooth transactions on Black Friday, Cyber Monday, Super Saturday and every other day.
Nashville, TN, August 27, 2015 --( PR.com )-- The retail Industry faces constant challenges in balancing competitive prices, high-quality customer service, and fast-moving sales. Consisting of multi-channel retail, mobile shoppers, showrooming, RFID and the IoT, retail consumption makes up an estimated two-thirds of U.S. gross domestic product (GDP).1
“For 24-hour retailing to operate smoothly, data connections between the on-line or in-store sales counter and back office must be reliable, secure and cost efficient,” says John Feeney, COO at Perle Systems. “Most people would be surprised by the number of Perle products integrated into your everyday shopping experience.”
The retail applications into which Perle Device-Networking products are integrated is extensive, from warehouses to grocery stores to department store installations. Sainsbury’s use Perle Terminal Servers in their warehouse distribution system. Nordstrom use Perle Console Servers to remotely access and manage their HP Blade Servers. Tesco use Perle Serial Cards in their home shopping service. A partial list of customers and case studies can be found on perle.com.
